results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Appointment at Seal Rocks
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes, K Porteous and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Every year between November and March many seals come to Seal Rocks in Bass Strait to bear their young and to mate

results.title: The Story of steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Industry Series No. 1”.
The story of the manufacture of steel, from the mining of the three raw materials, through the refining process, to the finished product in the rolling mill.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage [B&W]
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd, Kingcroft Productions and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-make bricks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd, Kingcroft Productions and National Trust

results.title: Beechworth
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Victoria, including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and National Trust
